abstract: In rejecting a proposed settlement with Spencer C. Barasch and requiring admissions in a small number of cases, the agency has taken two small steps toward burnishing its image as Wall Street’s top cop.
snippet: In rejecting a proposed settlement with Spencer C. Barasch and requiring admissions in a small number of cases, the agency has taken two small steps toward burnishing its image as Wall Street’s top cop.
lead_paragraph: One of the criticisms that has been leveled against the Securities and Exchange Commission is that even when it has pursued cases, it has not been tough enough in seeking sanctions for violations of the federal securities laws. Since the new year began, however, it seems that the agency has taken a couple of small steps to burnish its image as Wall Street’s top cop.

headline.main: In S.E.C.’s Actions, a Hint at a Tougher Stance
